attributes.action: Stop Parking Restrictions in Castleton, Derbyshire
attributes.additional_details:
Castleton is a beautiful Derbyshire villiage and a hugely popular centre for outdoor enthusiasts (in particular for caving, the castleton show-caves also representing an important tourist attraction).
According to the proposed parking restrictions, much of the village will be double yellow lined and parking meters will have a maximum stay of 4 hours.
The deadline for written objections is 02 September 2016, thus we have very little time to act. Please sign this petition and tell us why you care!
attributes.background:
Derbyshire County Council have proposed to restrict and charge for parking in Castleton.
Much of the village will be no-parking and parking meters will be short stay.
This will seriously affect businesses in a rural villiage which relies heavily on the trade of tourists and outdoor enthusiasts.

rejection.details:
We are only able to accept petitions addressed to central government or Parliament. Your petition concerns a matter which is the responsibility of Derbyshire County Council:
https://www.derbyshire.gov.uk/
